description.en:
This is an introductory course that is created for non-IT students. The aim of the course is to give the students an overview of practical information security problems and to teach the students to recognise the problems / threats related with information security. 

The topics are categorized into three groups. First group of lectures gives an overview of ways on how to protect your data and privacy. The second group of lectures gives an overview of public key cryptography and its applications. The third group of lectures starts with authentication and then focuses on different kinds of attacks (social engineering, web attacks, other technical attacks, wireless security and attacks against mobile networks).
description.et:
Tegemist on sissejuhatava kursusega infoturbesse, mis on peamiselt suunatud mitteinformaatikutele. Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda kuulajale ülevaade praktilistest infoturbega seotud probleemidest ja õpetada kuulajat infoturbest lähtuvaid probleeme tuvastama. 

Loengud on jaotatud kolmeks teemaplokiks. Esimene teemaplokk käsitleb enda andmete ja privaatsuse kaitsmist. Teine teemaplokk keskendub avaliku võtme krüptograafiale ning selle rakendustele (TLS, ID-kaart, mobiil-ID, e-hääletamine, blockchain). Kolmas teemaplokk annab ülevaate autentimismeetoditest, erinevat tüüpi rünnetest (kahjurvara klassifikatsioon, küberründed, õngitsusründed, erinevad veebiründed, wifi ründed, mobiilsidevõrkude vastased ründed) ning mõningatest kaitsemeetmetest.

independent_work.et: Homework is given after each topic.

description.et: After each major group of topics there will be a homework relevant to the given subject. All homework tasks together will grant 50 points that count for 50% of the final outcome.

Exam has two parts. The first part consists of short questions about information security terminology and facts. The second part has descriptions of practical scenarios and problems where the student has to pick and describe suitable tools and technologies that could be used in these situations. Exam gives 40 points and counts for 40% of the final grade.

There will be mini tests to check if the necessary knowledge was acquired during the lectures. These tests will give up to 5 points during the whole semester, i.e., up to 5% of the final grade. The details about the tests are on the course web page.

Each student will have to write an essay. The essay will give up to five points, i.e., up to 5% of the final grade. The contents of the essay have to be relevant to the the information security course. The topics and specific requirements for the essays will be posted to the course web page.

grade_preconditions.et: The student has to get at least 40 points during the semester to be allowed to attend the exam.The points can be collected from the homework tasks, tests and from an essay. In total it is possible to collect 60 points from the essay, homework tasks and tests.

grade_evaluation.et:
All homework tasks together will grant 50 points that counts for 50% of the final outcome. In addition, 5 points can be gathered from tests, i.e., 5% of the grade comes from tests. 

Each student will have to write an essay which gives up to 5 points that counts for 5% of the final grade.

A student is allowed to attend the exam only if 40 points have been collected before the exam. The exam gives 40 points and counts for 40% of the final grade.
It is possible to get up to 100 point in total. The final grade will be calculated as follows:

A - excellent (91 -100%)
B - very good (81 - 90%)
C - good (71 -80%)
D - satisfactory (61 - 70%)
E - pass (51 - 60%)
F - fail (0 - 50%)
